meanings.definition: To move quickly and directly towards a destination.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel beelined towards the tree to hide its acorn.
meanings.sent2: She beelined to the front of the line to buy tickets for the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat beelined towards the kitchen as soon as it heard the can opener.
meanings.sent4: The student beelined towards the library to borrow a book for research.
meanings.sent5: The dog beelined towards its owner when it heard the sound of a treat bag.

meanings.sent1: The bee beelined back to the hive after collecting nectar.
meanings.sent2: The hiker beelined through the forest towards the mountain peak.
meanings.sent3: The child beelined towards the playground as soon as they saw the swings.
meanings.sent4: The athlete beelined towards the finish line in the race.
meanings.sent5: The bird beelined towards the feeder for some seeds.
